title.narrative: IR 101 MOH AND NFNC FORMULATE UPDATED P

description.narrative: MoH and NFNC formulate updated policies, strategies and guidelines for demand generation and equitable access to nutrition, maternal, newborn, child health and paediatric HIV prevention, care, treatment and support services by 2015, which contributes to Child Health, Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Health Systems Strengthening, Hiv Prevention, Maternal And Newborn Health, Nutrition â€“ General, Pmtct And Infant Male Circumcision, Prevention Of Stunting And Other Forms Of Malnutrition, Treatment And Care Of Children Living With Hiv, Treatment Of Severe Acute Malnutrition. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Children, mothers and pregnant women benefit from high impact interventions contributing to the attainment of MDG targets for child and maternal survival and development.
